editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE; S. XIV ex.

msItem.title: A table of contents
msItem.note: s. xv, ending with WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE, De Praebendis (Ottmann, no. 7), no longer present; a hand of s. xvi notes its absence.

msItem.author: WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE
msItem.title: Cur Deus Homo
msItem.rubric: Hic incipit tractatus eiusdem Willelmi Cur Deus homo.
msItem.incipit: Cur Deus homo ponam ad hoc quattuor radices primam uirtutis nostre
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus domini Parisiensis Cur Deus homo.
msItem.note: Pr. Opera Guillelmi Alverni (Paris, 1674), I, cols 555–70; Glorieux, Théol. 141k; Ottmann, no. 1.

msItem.author: WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE
msItem.title: De Sacramentis
msItem.incipit: Dicemus in primis quia sacramentorum uirtus et utilitas tribus uiis preter illam quam hic intendimus stabilitur
msItem.note: Pr. Opera, I, cols. 407–55; Glorieux, Théol. 141o; Ottmann, no. 16.

msItem.author: WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE
msItem.title: Summa de Virtutibus et Vitiis
msItem.note: Pr. Opera, I, cols 102–328; Glorieux, Théol. 141j; Bloomfield 3982; Ottmann, no. 19.

msItem.incipit: Postquam iam claruit ex ordine ipso rerum diuinalium
msItem.explicit: (fol. 166v) cum triumphis nobilibus de medio eorum Deo gratias.

msItem.incipit: Ingrediemur hic huius tractatus partem que est de uiciis et peccatis
msItem.explicit: de infinibili felicitate humanarum animarum per omnia benedictus Deus amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de peccatis et uiciis secundum Magistrum Willelmum de Aluernia &c. amen.

msItem.author: WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE
msItem.title: De Gratia et Libero Arbitrio
msItem.incipit: Post hec autem gratiam stabilire qua post lapsum ad Deum redimus
msItem.note: Ed. G. Corti, Corona Lateranensis 7 (Rome, 1966), pp. 45–66; A. Landgraf, ‘Der Traktat de errore Pelagii des Wilhelm von Auvergne’, Speculum 5 (1930), 168–80; Glorieux, Théol. 141p; Stegmüller, Sent. 284, 12; Ottmann, no. 10. One of seven known copies, five of them English.

msItem.author: WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE
msItem.title: De Immortalitate Animae
msItem.incipit: Nosse debes ex aliis quia 4. modis consulitur humanis erroribus
msItem.note: Pr. Opera, I, cols 329–36; Glorieux, Théol. 141t; Ottmann, no. 11.

msItem.author: WILLIAM OF AUVERGNE
msItem.title: De Faciebus Mundi
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in libros de faciebus mundi a Willelmo de Aluernia episcopo Parisiensi edita.
msItem.incipit: Veritas euuangelica predicantibus in quibusdam est commissa
msItem.note: Copious marginal annotation, s. xv, probably much of it in the hand of Lorying (see below).
Unpr.; Glorieux, Théol. 141f; Charland, p. 40; Ottmann, no. 8.

supportDesc.collation: A bifolium, 112, 2–208, 214, 22–88, 298(lacks 7–8); quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form; catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 56 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Probably two similar English scribes, the second beginning at fol. 169, writing proficient gothic rotunda bookhand of university type, influenced by anglicana. Running heads, probably in the same hand, throughout.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red; red paraphs. The work is rather rough.

binding.p: Maltby 1965, brown goatskin; fols i-ii, 231–2 are modern paper blanks. On fol. iiiv are the marks of two straps and of a brass chain-staple at the foredge, near the foot. fol. iii was probably a pastedown (a sheet of modern parchment has been pasted over it as strengthening), and the last stub of quire 30 is probably the remains of the other.

history.provenance: On fol. iiiv‘Liber domus scolarium de Mertone in Oxonia ex dono M. Willelmi Loryng canonici ecclesie Sarum cathenandus in communi libraria eiusdem domus’. A hand of s. xvii has added ‘A.D. 1415’. Loryng (BRUO 1163), canon of Salisbury from 1363, d. by Feb. 1416. In 1415–16 the College paid Robert Maslyn 15s. 8d. to go to Salisbury ‘pro libris Loryng adquirendis’ (Appendix B, no. 85).
At the head of fol. 1 is ‘D. 7, 2’, s. xvii. On fol. iiivis ‘O. 3. 8. Art:’, s. xvii, and ‘L 3 6 (CXXXVI)’ in modern pencil.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
